nodePath.node().setFromCollideMask(GeomNode.getDefaultCollideMask())

cpp

node_path.set_collide_mask(GeomNode::get_default_collide_mask());

The .NodePath.get_collide_mask() method returns a union of all the collide masks for itself and its children. Since the .NodePath.set_collide_mask() method is called recursively on its children, the following code can have a profound effect, even though it looks like it's doing nothing:

python

nodePath.setCollideMask(nodePath.getCollideMask())

cpp

node_path.set_collide_mask(node_path.get_collide_mask());

The above code actually calculates the collide mask for its children, and sets all of its children to that same collide mask, wiping out what was there before.
